phrases.text: Excuse me, I have a problem.
phrases.usage: Use this to politely let the staff know about trouble.
phrases.example: Excuse me, I have a small problem in my room.

phrases.text: The air conditioning is not working.
phrases.usage: Say this to explain that the cooling machine is broken.
phrases.example: The air conditioning is not working and it is hot.

phrases.usage: Use this when a machine does not start at all.
phrases.example: I press the button but it does not turn on.

phrases.usage: Tell the staff which room you are staying in now.
phrases.example: My room number is five zero four in this hotel.

phrases.usage: Ask the staff to bring a worker to help you.
phrases.example: Can you send someone to fix the broken air conditioning?

phrases.usage: The staff tells you that a worker is coming soon.
phrases.example: A technician will come to your room in five minutes.

phrases.usage: The staff explains how long you must wait for help.
phrases.example: It will take ten minutes for the man to arrive.

phrases.text: So they will come now, right?
phrases.usage: Check that the help is coming to your room immediately.
phrases.example: So they will come now to fix the unit, right?

keyVocabulary.definition: Feeling a high temperature that is not very nice.
Feeling a low temperature that is not very nice.
Not working because something is wrong with the machine.
Not making any loud sounds so you can sleep.
Not clean and needing the staff to clean it.
